0.title: List of reserved wards for MCD election released
0.article_body: Delhi State Election Commission on Thursday released the list of wards that will be reserved for women and Scheduled Caste (SC) candidates for the upcoming Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) election. Out of the total 250 seats redrawn in the recently-concluded delimitation exercise, 42 have been reserved for SC candidates. Meanwhile, 50% of the overall seats are reserved for women.

1.title: Ajay's character's name in Thank God changed from Chitragupta to CG: Reports
1.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn's character's name in the upcoming movie 'Thank God' has been changed from Chitragupta to CG, according to reports. "The makers felt it was wise to avoid addressing him as Chitragupta...All dialogues where the word Chitragupta was mentioned were replaced with CG," a source was quoted as saying. The film has been passed with a U/A certificate.

2.title: Devotees visiting Kedarnath went from 5 lakh to 45 lakh in just 1 season: PM
2.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi claimed that the number of devotees visiting Kedarnath has increased significantly from 5 lakh to 45 lakh in just one season. He appealed to all the tourists to spend at least 5% of their travel budget on buying local products. He laid the foundation stone of several developmental projects in Uttarakhand.

3.title: Man seeks to be India's Prez to solve 'world affairs', SC calls plea 'abusive'
3.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday called an environmentalist's plea "scurrilous" after he sought appointment as the President of India, saying he wanted to work for all the 'messy situations of the world'. It said the petitioner Kishore Sawant's plea was "frivolous and an abuse of the process of the Court". Sawant's remarks must be expunged from records, it ordered.

4.title: Railway workers smuggle hash oil, ganja into B'luru from Assam, arrested
4.article_body: An AC attendant and two bedroll staffers of the North East Frontier Railway were arrested at Bengaluru's Baiyyappanahalli station for allegedly selling hash oil and ganja in the city after smuggling them from Assam. The contract workers allegedly used to hide drugs in the lockers assigned to them on trains. Police seized hash oil and ganja worth over ₹80 lakh.

5.title: Cargo train drives through flames after fuel tanker crash sparks fire in Mexico
5.article_body: A huge blaze erupted in central Mexico after a fuel tanker truck crashed into an overpass by a rail line on Thursday, scorching homes and leading to a mass evacuation, authorities said. One video shot from a car parked nearby showed a cargo train hurtling through the flames after the accident in Aguascalientes city. No casualties have been reported yet.

6.title: Prashant Kishor speaks for his own publicity: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar
6.article_body: After poll strategist Prashant Kishor accused Bihar CM Nitish Kumar of keeping a channel open with the BJP, the JD(U) leader said that Kishor speaks for his own publicity. "He keeps talking...[He] can say whatever he wants. We don't care. There was a time when I respected him...I don't know what's on his mind now," said Kumar.

7.title: 10,500 cubic metres of floating waste removed from rivers, nullahs: BMC
7.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) on Thursday said that 10,500 cubic metres of floating waste have been removed from rivers and nullahs in Mumbai by using trash booms. The BMC had deployed trash booms in eight spots to reduce water pollution, remove floating waste and silt materials. The trash booms were deployed this year on a ₹45 crore contract.

8.title: Iran advises citizens not to visit Ukraine, asks those in Ukraine to leave
8.article_body: Iran has advised its citizens not to travel to Ukraine and urged Iranians in Ukraine to leave. This comes a day after the US said that Iranians had been on the grounds in Crimea, helping Russians target Ukraine with Iranian drones. In a closed-door UN meeting, US, UK and France accused Iran of selling drones to Russia, violating a ban.

9.title: Kejriwal silent on stubble burning in Punjab this time: Anil Vij
9.article_body: Haryana Home Minister Anil Vij criticised AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal over stubble burning in Punjab, which causes air pollution in Delhi. "While Kejriwal used to speak about the stubble burning issue earlier, this time he has not yet spoken," said Vij. AAP is not doing anything about the issue even though the party is in power in Punjab, he added.

10.title: Rahul Gandhi to attend Kharge's oath ceremony on October 26: Reports
10.article_body: According to reports, Congress MP Rahul Gandhi is set to attend the oath-taking ceremony of Mallikarjun Kharge as the Congress National President in New Delhi on October 26. A change has also been made in the Bharat Jodo Yatra schedule. A three-day break has been kept for Rahul's rest, starting October 24.

11.title: Pak's Nawaz sits on knees in shock after his shot hits Masood on head, video surfaces
11.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing Pakistan's Muhammad Nawaz sitting on his knees in shock after his shot hit his teammate Shan Masood on the head during net practice. In the video, Nawaz also stands up and shakes his head, while Masood was being checked on by the support staff. Masood was taken to hospital for scans.

12.title: Don't want Ranveer in 'Khal Nayak' remake, he doesn't wear clothes: Sanjay Dutt
12.article_body: Taking a dig at Ranveer Singh's nude photoshoot, Sanjay Dutt said he doesn't want him to play his role in 'Khal Nayak' remake as the actor doesn't wear clothes these days. He was responding to a question by Varun Sharma on comedy courtroom show 'Case Toh Banta Hai'. Ranveer hit headlines in July when he posed naked for Paper Magazine.

13.title: IDBI Bank's Q2 profit grows by 46% to ₹828 crore, NII rises by 48%
13.article_body: IDBI Bank, on Friday, posted a 46% year-on-year growth in standalone profit for the quarter ended September 30 to ₹828 crore from ₹567 crore in the corresponding period last fiscal. The growth was led by its net interest income (NII), which grew by 47.7% to ₹2,738 crore and its operating performance. Its net advances were ₹1.46 lakh crore.

14.title: Maharashtra govt restores general consent to CBI to probe cases in state
14.article_body: Eknath Shinde-led Maharashtra government has reversed the previous Uddhav Thackeray-led Maha Vikas Aghadi government's decision of withdrawing the general consent to the CBI to investigate cases in the state. The Maharashtra government has restored the general consent given to the central probe agency, an official said. CBI will now no longer require the state government's permission to step in.

15.title: Kevin Spacey wins $40 million sexual assault lawsuit
15.article_body: A New York court has cleared Kevin Spacey in a $40 million sexual misconduct lawsuit. An actor had filed a lawsuit, claiming Spacey sexually abused him in 1985 when he was 14. After a three week-long trial, the jury found that prosecution couldn't prove Spacey had "touched a sexual or intimate body part", leading the judge to dismiss the case.

16.title: Russia planning to destroy hydroelectric dam in Kherson: Ukraine
16.article_body: Ukraine has claimed Russia is planning to sabotage the Kakhovka hydropower plant in the Russian-controlled Kherson region. "Russia is preparing a man-made catastrophe," a Ukrainian presidential aide stated on Thursday. He said Russia was mining the dam and transformers at the plant to flood the lower Dnieper River, where Ukrainian troops are mounting a counteroffensive against Russian forces.

17.title: US judge blocks New York from banning guns in church
17.article_body: A US federal judge has temporarily blocked the part of a New York state law that bans firearms from churches or other places of worship. Last week, two church leaders sued the state, saying such a constraint ran counter to the gun rights spelled out in the Second Amendment of US Constitution. New York Attorney General is reviewing the decision.

18.title: Russia says Ukraine killed 4 civilians evacuating Kherson, Ukraine denies
18.article_body: Russia has accused Ukrainian forces of deliberately attacking civilians evacuating from Russia-controlled region of Kherson, killing four and injuring 13. A Ukrainian official said the strike was carried out after the civilian curfew was put in place and people evacuating were part of Russia's security structures. Russian-installed authorities are evacuating 50,000-60,000 people from Kherson.

19.title: Sajid Khan showed me his genitals and made me touch them: Sherlyn Chopra
19.article_body: Sherlyn Chopra, who recently filed a complaint against #MeToo accused Sajid Khan, said, "Police asked me why it took me so long...I said...back then I didn't have the courage." "Sajid asked some [women] about sex...he showed me his genitals and made me touch them," she added. "Can a woman not share her pain even years after the incident?" Sherlyn stated.

20.title: 22-yr-old arrested for shooting at neighbour over parking issue in Delhi
20.article_body: Delhi Police arrested a 22-year-old for allegedly shooting at a 42-year-old neighbour over a parking issue in Vikas Nagar. "The victim was admitted to a hospital with a gunshot injury...after the treatment, he was said to be out of danger," DCP Sameer Sharma (Outer district) said. The accused was arrested from Ganda Nala within 24 hours after the incident.

21.title: Mumbai woman fights off child lifters, saves her 3-yr-old son
21.article_body: A woman fought and saved her three-year-old son from allegedly being snatched by three child lifters in Mumbai. The incident happened when the mother-son duo was walking on an empty road at Lokhandwala Township in Kandivali East, police said. The mother, Dipti Joshi (39), claimed that the accused were eunuchs, however, police suspect that might not be the case.

22.title: J&K administration asks Mehbooba Mufti to vacate official bungalow
22.article_body: J&K administration has served a notice to PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti to vacate her official bungalow in Srinagar's Gupkar. "The notice to evict from Fair View...has not come as a surprise and is along the expected lines," the former J&K CM said. "This place was allotted to my father in December 2005, after he relinquished the CM's office," Mufti added.

23.title: We don't expect UK to use political wisdom in choosing next PM: Kremlin
23.article_body: The Kremlin has said it did not expect UK to use "political wisdom" in choosing next leader. "People do not choose the person at the head of the executive branch, who appears as a result of internal party shake-ups," Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov said. Russian Foreign Ministry said former UK PM Liz Truss would be remembered for her "catastrophic illiteracy".

24.title: BSE, NSE to conduct 'muhurat trading' from 6:15 pm to 7:15 pm on Diwali
24.article_body: The BSE and the National Stock Exchange will conduct the Diwali 'muhurat trading' on Monday from 6:15 pm to 7:15 pm, the exchanges stated. The block deal session will take place from 5:45 pm to 6 pm and the pre-opening session will be held from 6 pm-6:08 pm. This will mark the beginning of the new Hindu calendar year—Samvat 2079.

25.title: We've disappointed our fans, haven't batted well: Pooran on WI's T20 WC exit
25.article_body: After two-time champions West Indies were eliminated from T20 World Cup 2022 following their nine-wicket loss against Ireland in Group B, West Indies captain Nicholas Pooran said his side haven't batted well in the tournament. "We have disappointed our fans and ourselves. It's definitely hurting. I've disappointed my guys," he added. Chasing 147, Ireland scored 150/1 in 17.3 overs.

26.title: Section 144 to be imposed in Mumbai from November 1 to November 15: Police
26.article_body: Mumbai Police has issued an order stating that Section 144 will be imposed in the city from November 1 to November 15. The decision came after considering inputs from various agencies that warned about a disturbance in the law-and-order situation in the city. Accordingly, gathering of over five people in public places, processions and bursting of firecrackers have been banned.

27.title: Russian jet fired missile near British spy plane over Black Sea in Sept: UK
27.article_body: UK Defence Minister Ben Wallace has said a Russian fighter jet released a missile near an unarmed British spy plane patrolling the international airspace over the Black Sea in September. "It is a reminder of...how dangerous things can be when you...use your fighters in the manner that Russians have done," Wallace said. "We...concur it was a malfunction", Wallace added.

28.title: Debt-laden Future Retail's bid deadline extended to November 3
28.article_body: The resolution professional (RP) for debt-laden Future Retail Limited has extended the deadline, which ended on Thursday, for potential buyers to submit their bids. The new deadline is November 3. Future Retail, once the country's second-largest retailer, has been in bankruptcy proceedings after it defaulted on loans. Its lenders rejected a $3.4 billion sale of its assets to Reliance Industries.

29.title: 2 dead bodies found after army helicopter crash in Arunachal Pradesh
29.article_body: At least two dead bodies have been recovered from the site where an Indian Army helicopter crashed in Arunachal Pradesh's Upper Siang district on Friday, officials said. At least three people were on board the Advanced Light Helicopter (ALH) which crashed, triggering a search and rescue operation. Efforts are underway to find the rest of those on board.

30.title: T'gana's Yadagirigutta temple gets 'Green Place of Worship' award
30.article_body: Sri Lakshmi Narasimha Swamy Temple in Telangana's Yadagirigutta has been awarded 'Green Place of Worship' by Indian Green Building Council (IGBC) for 2022 to 2025. The award was given for complying with norms like extensive greenery of over 40% of the area, according to Yadagirigutta Temple Development Authority. State CM K Chandrashekar Rao expressed happiness over the temple being awarded.

31.title: PM Modi to visit Ayodhya on Diwali eve to offer prayers at Ram temple
31.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will visit Ayodhya in Uttar Pradesh on the eve of Diwali (Sunday) to offer prayers at the Ram temple, the Prime Minister's Office said. The PM will also perform a symbolic coronation of Lord Ram and will later witness aarti at New Ghat, Saryu river, it added. Thereafter, he will launch the Deepotsav celebrations in Ayodhya.

32.title: It's not about Ranveer but award shows: Vivek on his 'colourful star' tweet
32.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri has opened up about his tweet where he criticised Bollywood award shows, saying that a "colourful star managed to get all 10+ awards despite both of his films being disasters". Some people on Twitter speculated that he was referring to Ranveer Singh. Vivek said, "It's not about him. It's about the way these award events function."

33.title: Kejriwal issues order to ensure Yamuna is not polluted during Chhath
33.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Friday said that officials have been ordered to ensure that the Yamuna river is not polluted during Chhath Puja. "Chhath Puja will be celebrated like before on the ghats of the Yamuna," he tweeted. Earlier this month, Kejriwal said that the Delhi government has made arrangements at 1,100 sites for Chhath Puja celebrations.

34.title: Accidentally hurt Vinod during 'Muqaddar...' shoot, he got 16 stitches: Big B
34.article_body: On an episode of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 14', Amitabh Bachchan revealed that he accidentally hurt his co-star, late actor Vinod Khanna, during the filming of 'Muqaddar Ka Sikandar'. He added that Vinod had to be rushed to a hospital, where he got 16 stitches. "I took him home to his wife, and apologised to her too for...accident," said Amitabh.

35.title: India's Lakshya beats compatriot Prannoy to enter Denmark Open quarters
35.article_body: Indian shuttler Lakshya Sen defeated compatriot HS Prannoy to enter the men's singles quarter-final at Denmark Open on Thursday. The CWG 2022 gold medal-winning shuttler won with a scoreline of 21-9, 21-18. Earlier in the day, Kidambi Srikanth lost 13-21, 15-21 to seventh seed Loh Kean Yew of Singapore. Meanwhile, Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty entered the men's doubles quarter-final.

36.title: Hyd to increase sewage treatment plant capacity to curb Hussain Sagar pollution
36.article_body: To curb pollution in Hussain Sagar Lake, the Hyderabad Metropolitan Development Authority (HMDA) has decided to double the capacity of Sewage Treatment Plants (STP). The STPs which are currently functioning under Hussain Sagar Lake Project were constructed in collaboration with a Japanese firm between 2012-14. The capacity of existing STPs ranges from five to 60 MLD (Million Litres per Day).

37.title: HDFC Life Insurance's net profit grows by 19.25% in Sept quarter
37.article_body: HDFC Life Insurance Company on Friday posted a 19.25% growth in its consolidated net profit for the quarter ended September at ₹329.02 crore. Its net premium income rose by 14.56% to ₹13,137.89 crore. The company's solvency ratio improved to 210% year-on-year from 190%. For the first half of the fiscal, its annual premium equivalent grew 11%.

38.title: Putin hugs Russian soldiers, fires sniper rifle as he visits training camp
38.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday inspected a training ground for the newly drafted personnel who will participate in Moscow's 'special military operation' in Ukraine. Russian state television showed Putin lying flat on the ground and firing from a rifle during the visit to the training camp in the Ryazan region. The 70-year-old was also seen hugging military men.

39.title: Elon Musk's deals may face security reviews in US: Report
39.article_body: The US government is reportedly considering reviewing some of Tesla CEO Elon Musk's deals and operations over potential national security risks. Musk's bid to acquire Twitter can be among the deals that face scrutiny as authorities are concerned about foreign investors involved in the deal, Bloomberg reported. Musk's satellite internet service network Starlink can also reportedly face review.

40.title: Some people are justifying targeted killings in valley: J&K Lt Guv
40.article_body: J&K LG Manoj Sinha warned people who are justifying the targeted killings of citizens in the valley and said that action will be taken against those who are trying to jeopardise the nation's integrity. "We are keeping an eye on elements that are trying to jeopardise communal harmony. Some people are justifying the killings...because of their self-interest," said Sinha.

41.title: 2 dead bodies mistakenly swapped at Pimpri Chinchwad civic hospital
41.article_body: Two dead bodies were mistakenly swapped at Yashwantrao Chavan Memorial Hospital run by Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation on Wednesday. The family of one of the deceased also performed the last rites of the wrong corpse they had received. The other family noticed the blunder while claiming the body. Upset with this, they attacked the dean and vandalised the hospital.

42.title: Amazon shuts down online store Fabric.com 14 yrs after acquisition
42.article_body: Amazon has closed online fabric store Fabric.com which was launched in 1999. Amazon acquired the store in 2008, saying this would give its crafting customers more variety to choose from. "As part of our regular business planning, we continually evaluate the progress and potential of our offerings and have made the decision to close Fabric.com," Amazon spokesperson Betsy Harden said.

43.title: Noida to come up with dog policy, 18 shelters to be constructed
43.article_body: After complaints and conflicts among residents related to dog attacks, Noida authority announced to draw up a dog policy, which includes the construction of 18 stray dog shelters. It will also earmark two or three feeding points. A list of dog feeders is also being prepared and the authority has asked people to volunteer to feed the strays.

44.title: 3 workers die while working in septic tank of Pune housing society
44.article_body: Three workers reportedly died while manually cleaning a septic tank of a private housing society in Pune's Wagholi on Friday. "The victims were working in an 18-feet deep drainage-cum-septic tank. It seems...they were suffocated and got stuck inside," an official said. The bodies of all three workers have been recovered.

45.title: Ex-Pak PM Imran Khan barred from holding public office in state gifts case
45.article_body: The Election Commission of Pakistan has disqualified former Pakistan PM Imran Khan from holding public office for allegedly misleading officials about gifts he got from foreign leaders while in power. Khan allegedly received gifts worth millions of dollars and failed to declare some of them and unlawfully sold them. Khan will consequently lose his Parliament seat.

46.title: Lacks integrity: TikTok on report claiming it planned to track US citizens
46.article_body: TikTok has denied allegations made in a Forbes report that its China-based parent firm ByteDance planned to use the app to track location of specific US citizens. Stating that the reporting lacks "journalistic integrity", TikTok said it "doesn't collect precise GPS location" of US users. The app has "never been used to target" US government members or activists, TikTok said.

47.title: Consignment of smuggled liquor worth ₹13.37 lakh seized in Palghar
47.article_body: A consignment of smuggled Indian-made foreign liquor worth ₹13.37 lakh was seized in Pawan village in Palghar, Maharashtra. The police seized the liquor when they went to search an abandoned tempo in Dahanu's Kasa area of the village. The liquor was being brought in from the Union Territory of Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu, police said.

48.title: It's my duty: Chinese diplomat defends pulling HK protestor's hair in UK
48.article_body: A Chinese diplomat filmed pulling the hair of a Hong Kong pro-democracy protester on the grounds of the consulate in Manchester last week, defended his actions, saying it was his "duty". The demonstrator had "abused my country, my leader [Xi Jinping]", Chinese Consul-General Zheng Xiyuan said. Any diplomat would do the same if faced with such behaviour, he added.

49.title: DeHaat raises $45.8 million at $695 million valuation: Report
49.article_body: Agritech startup DeHaat has secured $45.8 million in a Series E funding round led by Sofina Ventures at $695 million valuation, Moneycontrol reported citing company's filing. The round also saw participation from RTP Global, Prosus and Lightrock India. The company was founded in 2012 by IIT, IIM and NIT alumni Shashank Kumar, Adarsh Srivastava, Shyam Sundar Singh and Amrendra Singh.

50.title: When I watch Indian action film I feel I'm working in wrong nation: H'wood director on RRR
50.article_body: Praising SS Rajamouli's 'RRR', Hollywood director Daniel Kwan tweeted, "After a...year of work and travelling I've finally checked a couple things off my list 1) finished my taxes (I know the irony) and 2) watched 'RRR'." "HOLY COW ya'll weren't kidding. Anytime I watch an Indian action film I feel like I'm working in the wrong country," he added.

51.title: Hyd woman trafficked from UAE to Oman, tortured; son seeks govt help
51.article_body: A man has urged External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar to repatriate his 42-year-old Hyderabadi mother, who's stuck in Oman with health complications, to India. Shaheen Begum had reportedly flown to the UAE from Hyderabad to work as a housemaid. Her son said she was later trafficked from the UAE to Oman, where she's being tortured while working as a housemaid.

52.title: Actress Anna May Wong becomes 1st Asian-American to be featured on US currency
52.article_body: Late Hollywood actress Anna May Wong is set to become first Asian-American to feature on US currency. A quarter-dollar coin featuring Wong's face will begin circulating from October 24, US Mint said. "Wong left a lasting legacy for Asian American women with an accomplished career in motion pictures, television, and theatre," White House Initiative on AA and NHPIs said.

53.title: Adani Group mulls raising $10 billion debt next year: Report
53.article_body: Adani Group is reportedly planning to raise at least $10 billion in new debt through next year to refinance large borrowings and fund projects in its pipeline, Bloomberg News quoted sources as saying. The Gautam Adani-led conglomerate could use foreign currency debt and green bonds to raise up to $6 billion to swap its current high-interest debt with lower-cost borrowings.

54.title: SC agrees to hear plea against release of Bilkis Bano rape convicts
54.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday agreed to hear a plea filed by the National Federation of Indian Women against the early release of 11 convicts in the Bilkis Bano gangrape case. Earlier, the Gujarat government told the court that the convicts were released with the Centre's approval. Bilkis was 21 years old and five-month pregnant when she was gangraped.

55.title: We won't penalise employees for working remotely: IBM Consulting
55.article_body: IBM Consulting is asking employees to return to office three days per week. The company, however, has stated it will not penalise employees who are unable to go into the workplace. "We understand the importance of balancing both your work and home life as we move to a hybrid work model," the company said in its Return to Workplace FAQs.

56.title: Soothe Healthcare raises ₹175 crore in a fresh funding round
56.article_body: Soothe Healthcare, a personal hygiene brand, has secured ₹175 crore in a fresh funding round, in which the US International Development Finance Corporation invested ₹55 crore. Existing investors including A91 Partners, Symphony, Sixth Sense and Gulf Islamic Investments invested ₹120 crore. In 2021, it raised ₹230 crore in Series C round led by Northern Arc, and InCred, among others.

57.title: Enhance anti-money laundering system: US regulator to ICICI New York branch
57.article_body: ICICI Bank's New York branch has been issued a consent order by the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency in the US for its failure to comply with anti-money laundering rules and the Bank Secrecy Act. The order requires the branch to ensure compliance and its general manager will have to submit a written action plan within 60 days.

58.title: BMW Group to invest $1.7 billion to produce EVs in US
58.article_body: The BMW Group will invest $1.7 billion to produce EVs in the US. The investment of $1 billion will be used to prepare for producing EVs at the company's existing manufacturing facility in South Carolina and $700 million will be used to build a battery assembly facility. The German automaker partnered with Envision AESC, which will produce lithium-ion battery cells.

59.title: Gurugram man cheated of ₹1 cr on pretext of mutual fund investments
59.article_body: A couple has been booked for allegedly cheating an 83-year-old man of over ₹1 crore on pretext of investing in mutual funds in Gurugram, police said. The man is a retired Lok Sabha staffer. "The complainant had managed to recover over ₹30 lakh by writing to firms where his money had been invested with forged documents," a police officer said.

60.title: Russian court orders arrest of journalist who protested war on live TV
60.article_body: A Russian court has ordered the arrest of journalist Marina Ovsyannikova, who protested against the Russian invasion of Ukraine during an on-air news bulletin, Interfax reported. Ovsyannikova's lawyer earlier said that she fled Russia after refusing to be under house arrest. The journalist was accused of spreading fake news about Russian armed forces during one-person protest near the Kremlin.

61.title: PM Modi lays foundation stone of connectivity projects worth ₹3,400 cr in Uttarakhand
61.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday laid the foundation stone of various connectivity projects worth over ₹3,400 crore at Mana village in Uttarakhand's Chamoli district. The projects unveiled by the PM include two new ropeway projects connecting Gaurikund to Kedarnath and Govindghat to Hemkund Sahib. "For me, every village on the border is the first village in India," PM added.

62.title: SC dismisses plea seeking opening of 22 rooms of Taj Mahal
62.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday dismissed a plea seeking the "opening of 22 rooms" on the premises of the Taj Mahal and a "fact-finding inquiry" into the monument's history. The petition was earlier dismissed by Allahabad High Court. "The high court was not in error in dismissing the petition, which is more of a publicity interest litigation," the SC said.

63.title: 3-year-old shoots and kills 15-month-old baby in US; probe on
63.article_body: A 15-month-old baby has died after being shot in the face by a three-year-old in the US state of Pennsylvania on Tuesday. The victim's grandfather told local media that the three-year-old was a relative. The Lancaster Bureau of Police is investigating the incident and said that adults were being questioned. No arrests have been made so far.

64.title: Missing food delivery executive found dead in nullah in Pune
64.article_body: A food delivery executive who went missing on October 17 was found dead on Friday in a nullah in Pune, police said. The deceased's brother claimed that it was raining heavily when his brother went to deliver food and added, "We suspect he might've got washed away in...rainwater." A probe is on to ascertain cause of death, an inspector said.

65.title: Girl gets paper re-checked, beats twin sister to become Class 12 UP board exam topper
65.article_body: Divya from Fatehpur district has become the new topper of Class 12 Uttar Pradesh board exam, taking away the top spot from her twin sister Divyanshi who scored 477/500. Divya, who scored 56 marks in Hindi, had applied for re-evaluation of the paper, following which the marks rose to 94, District Inspector of Schools said. Divya has scored 479/500.

66.title: ED seizes jewellery worth ₹149 cr during raids in Hyderabad, Vijayawada
66.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) said it has seized jewellery stocks worth more than ₹149 crore during recent raids at five locations in Hyderabad and Vijayawada. The raids were conducted in a case related to alleged cheating with MMTC, a public sector enterprise. The search operations were conducted at MBS Jewellers Pvt Ltd and Musaddilal Gems and Jewels India Pvt Ltd.

67.title: List of 10 all time best Indian films released
67.article_body: The India chapter of the International Federation of Film Critics (FIPRESCI) has released a list of the top 10 films in the history of Indian cinema. Satyajit Ray's Pather Panchali topped the list followed by 1960 drama Meghe Dhaka Tara, Bhuvan Shome (1969), Malayalam film Elippathayam (1981), Ghatashraddha (1977) and Garm Hava (1973). Sholay has been ranked 10th by FIPRESCI.

68.title: Fraudster arrested for cheating Mumbai investor of ₹12 lakh
68.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested a 38-year-old fraudster from Tamil Nadu for allegedly cheating a man of ₹12 lakh on the pretext of high returns on diamond trading investment. The police has seized at least five crypto wallets in which cryptocurrency worth lakhs of rupees was kept. It has also confiscated 119 mobile phones used by the accused.

69.title: At least 150 people killed in 2 days of fighting in Sudan
69.article_body: At least 150 people have reportedly been killed in ethnic clashes in the last two days in Sudan's Blue Nile state. The violence broke out last week between rival ethnic groups following a land dispute in which more than a dozen people were killed. Sudan has been grappling with political unrest and violence since last year's military coup.

70.title: Priyanka Gandhi to hold 8 rallies, roadshows in Himachal Pradesh
70.article_body: Ahead of the Himachal Pradesh polls, Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi will hold eight rallies and roadshows in the state until November 10. She will start her campaign from Mandi and Kullu on October 31 before visiting Kangra and Chamba on November 3. The state will go to polls on November 12 and the votes will be counted on December 8.

71.title: Youths who pelted stones in J&K now becoming sarpanches: Amit Shah
71.article_body: On the occasion of Police Commemoration Day, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that youths who pelted stones in Jammu and Kashmir are now becoming panches and sarpanches. "Earlier, armed forces were given special power, now youth is given special power for their progress," he added. Most hotspots in the country are "almost free" from anti-national activities, he further said.

72.title: Sachin Tendulkar forays into NFTs as a strategic investor in Rario
72.article_body: Rario, a licensed digital cricket collectibles platform, announced that Sachin Tendulkar has invested in and partnered with the company for his exclusive NFTs/digital collectibles. Rario stated that it has already exclusively partnered with Aaron Finch, Quinton de Kock, Shakib Al Hasan, Rishabh Pant, Virender Sehwag, Zaheer Khan, Smriti Mandhana, Cricket Australia, New Zealand Cricket among others.

73.title: Muslims can never trust people who worship Godse: SP MLA Mehmood
73.article_body: Samajwadi Party (SP) MLA Iqbal Mehmood on Thursday claimed that Muslims can never vote for BJP as they can "never trust people who worship Godse, the killer of Mahatma Gandhi". He also alleged that the AIMIM, which is led by Asaduddin Owaisi, is BJP's "B team". "A true Muslim can never vote for BJP," he further said.

74.title: Video shows bus on fire in Andhra; passengers lose cash, jewellery
74.article_body: A bus carrying about 60 passengers was gutted in fire in Andhra Pradesh on Friday, a video of which has surfaced. No passengers were hurt in the incident, however, many lost their belongings, including cash, gold jewellery and other valuables. The fire reportedly started in the engine. The driver noticed the smoke and evacuated the bus before it was engulfed.

75.title: Virat Kohli asks fans to not speak while he is practising, video goes viral
75.article_body: A video went viral showing Virat Kohli telling fans not to speak while he was practising in the nets. In the video, a fan can be heard shouting "Out of the stadium" after Kohli hit a ball. After that, Kohli said, "Please don't speak while I'm practising...It's very distracting." The fans can then be heard telling Kohli they won't speak.

76.title: Diwali to be a public school holiday in New York City schools from 2023
76.article_body: Diwali will be a public school holiday in New York City starting next year. Mayor Eric Adams announced plans to include the holiday in the public school schedule on Thursday. "We're going to have children start talking about what it is to celebrate the Festival of Lights, and how do you turn a light on within yourself," Adams said.

77.title: World War 3 very unlikely, it's the closest we have been since 1962: Elon Musk
77.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk said the World War 3 is "still very unlikely" to happen. In response to a Twitter user's query on the likelihood of a world war, Musk wrote that this is the closest the world has been since 1962 Cuban Missile Crisis. "It...would be nice to have one year without a horrible global event," he added.

78.title: Policeman steals gold ornaments from friend's house in Kerala
78.article_body: A policeman has been arrested for allegedly stealing eight sovereigns of gold ornaments from his friend's house in Kerala's Ernakulam district. The police suspect that online rummy gaming led the accused, 35-year-old Amal Dev, to indulge in theft. "He was a regular visitor to his friend's house...The investigation on the visitors of the house led to him," said police.

79.title: 2-time champions West Indies crash out of T20 World Cup 2022
79.article_body: Two-time champions West Indies crashed out of T20 World Cup 2022 after losing their Group B first round match against Ireland on Friday. Ireland restricted West Indies to 146/5 in 20 overs before chasing down the target in 17.3 overs. Ireland have qualified for the Super 12 stage by winning two out of three matches in the first round.

80.title: Politician Shrikant Tyagi, who assaulted Noida woman, garlanded after release
80.article_body: Politician Shrikant Tyagi, who was arrested for assaulting a woman in Noida, was garlanded after his release from jail. A video surfaced online in which his supporters can be seen showering flowers on him and shouting "Shrikant bhaiya zindabad". "One of our sisters was put forward...attempt was made to finish me politically by staging a dispute between us," Tyagi said.

81.title: Govt eyeing $7.7 billion valuation for IDBI Bank stake sale: Report
81.article_body: The government is pushing for a valuation of nearly $7.7 billion for IDBI Bank, which could be the biggest sale of the government's stake in a lender in decades, Bloomberg quoted a source as saying. The regulatory approvals and security clearances could be reportedly given to bidders after November. IDBI Bank's market value was about $5.8 billion as of Thursday.

82.title: Musk & Twitter's advisers prepare to close deal by Oct end: Report
82.article_body: Elon Musk and Twitter's advisers are preparing paperwork to complete the $44 billion takeover deal by October 28, Bloomberg reported. Talks between SpaceX CEO and the social media platform have reportedly turned cordial after months of accusations, with focus on closing the transaction. The Wall Street banks are working on steps to finalise funding about $13 billion of debt commitments.

83.title: Putin critic Navalny says he faces new criminal case, up to 30 yrs in jail
83.article_body: Jailed Russian opposition politician Alexey Navalny on Thursday said that Russian authorities have opened a new criminal case against him for "promoting terrorism and extremism" that could potentially more than double his current prison sentence. The 46-year-old critic of Russian President Vladimir Putin is currently serving more than 11 years for fraud, contempt of court and parole violations.

84.title: Army helicopter crashes in Arunachal Pradesh
84.article_body: An Army helicopter crashed in Arunachal Pradesh on Friday, according to reports. The site of accident is not connected by road and a rescue team has been sent, Defence PRO, Guwahati, said. Earlier this month, a MiG-29K fighter aircraft crashed during a routine sortie over sea off Goa coast after it developed a technical malfunction while returning to base.

85.title: Why has Google been fined ₹1,337.76 crore by the CCI?
85.article_body: The CCI has imposed ₹1,337.76 crore fine on Google for abusing its dominant position in multiple markets in Android mobile device ecosystem. Google imposes "unfair condition" on device makers by requiring them to preinstall its apps, the CCI said. It added that Google abused its dominant position in search, app stores, web browsers and video services to squeeze out competitors.

86.title: Google sued by Texas for allegedly collecting biometric data without consent
86.article_body: US state of Texas has filed a lawsuit against Google for allegedly collecting biometric data of millions of Texans, since 2015, without prior consent. Google used people's faces and voices through Google Photos, Google Assistant, and Nest Hub Max, the complaint said. Google said it will fight the case, adding that users had option to turn off biometric collection feature.

87.title: Girl allegedly gets poked in an eye with pencil at Punjab school, loses sight
87.article_body: A six-year-old girl's parents staged a protest outside a school in Punjab's Ludhiana after a classmate allegedly poked her in the eye with a pencil causing her to lose sight in one eye. The parents claimed that the school misled them about the cause of the injury and sent their daughter home instead of rushing her to a hospital.

88.title: Shah pays tribute at police memorial, says their sacrifice will be remembered
88.article_body: On the occasion of Police Commemoration Day, Union Home Minister Amit Shah paid tribute to police personnel, who lost their lives in the line of duty, at the National Police Memorial. He said that their sacrifice would always be remembered. The day is observed every year in memory of the 10 policemen killed by Chinese troops in 1959.

89.title: Delhivery's stock hits record low after falling below IPO price
89.article_body: Shares of logistics company Delhivery fell by nearly 18% on Friday to ₹382.25 as it expected moderate growth of shipment volumes for the rest of FY23. The Gurugram-based company's stock is now below its IPO price of ₹487/share, which is a record low since it was listed on the bourses earlier this year. On Thursday, its shares plunged by 17.07%.

90.title: IAS officer Narain gets transit anticipatory bail in alleged rape case
90.article_body: Delhi HC granted transit anticipatory bail till October 28 to senior IAS officer Jitendra Narain for his alleged involvement in a rape case. "It wouldn't be appropriate to consider the allegations and counter allegations at this stage as it may prejudice the case of either party," HC said. Narain is accused of raping a woman in Andaman and Nicobar Islands.

91.title: Gurugram Police book banker & wife for cheating retired officer of ₹1 crore
91.article_body: The Gurugram Police booked a couple for allegedly cheating a retired central government officer of ₹1 crore on the pretext of investing his money in the share market. According to police, the prime suspect worked at a private bank while his wife was a sub-broker with an investment firm. The accused confessed to losing ₹1 crore in betting.

92.title: Important that UK finds stability as soon as possible: French Prez
92.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron said it was important that Britain found "stability as soon as possible" amid the resignation of British Prime Minister Liz Truss. "On a personal level, I am always sad to see a colleague go," he added. Liz Truss resigned as UK Prime Minister on Thursday after 45 days in office amid a massive economic crisis.

93.title: Governor seeks report on sexual assault of 4-yr-old girl in Hyd
93.article_body: Telangana Governor Tamilisai Soundararajan has sought a report from the state government on the alleged sexual assault of a four-year-old girl, an LKG student, at Hyderabad's DAV Public School by the principal's driver. Soundararajan called for immediate action against the perpetrator. The driver was arrested on Tuesday, while the principal was arrested for negligence a day later.

94.title: Harsha Bhogle names his all-time T20 World Cup XI; includes 1 Indian, 2 Pakistani players
94.article_body: Cricket commentator Harsha Bhogle has named his all-time T20 World Cup XI. Virat Kohli features as the only Indian, and Shahid Afridi and Umar Gul features as two Pakistani cricketers in his XI. He named Chris Gayle and Jos Buttler as the openers. Other players include Kevin Pietersen, Michael Hussey, Shane Watson, Lasith Malinga, Trent Bould and Samuel Badree.

95.title: India can't dictate how Pakistan will play cricket: Wasim Akram
95.article_body: Reacting to BCCI Secretary Jay Shah saying India won't travel to Pakistan for Asia Cup 2023 and will look for a neutral venue, ex-Pakistan captain Wasim Akram said, "India can’t dictate how Pakistan will play cricket." He added, "If Shah had to say something...he should've called PCB chief Ramiz Raja. There should have been a meeting of Asian Cricket Council."

96.title: Woman slaps guard, pulls female guard's hair as fight breaks out at Noida society
96.article_body: A woman was seen slapping a guard and pulling a female guard's hair after a fight broke out between two groups of residents at a society in Noida. The fight started at the Hyde Park society in Sector 78 over a residents' body election. Security guards were accused of manipulating the election and helping one of the groups.

97.title: Pic of close up of ant's face wins photography competition; people call it 'horrifying'
97.article_body: A picture of an ant's face, magnified five times under a microscope, has won the 2022 Nikon Small World Photomicrography Competition. Reacting to the picture by Lithuanian photographer Eugenijus Kavaliauskas, social media users wrote, "Horrifying," and, "Is this an alien?" Reacting to the comments, the photographer said, "There are no horrors in nature."

98.title: Earlier govts made fun of tribal traditions, we respect them: PM
98.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday laid the foundation stone of multiple development initiatives worth over ₹1,970 crore in Gujarat's Tapi and said that there are political parties who've a history of making false promises, however, BJP has always given priority to tribal welfare. "While earlier governments made fun of tribal traditions, we on the other hand respect...tribal traditions," he added.

99.title: 3 die of asphyxiation while cleaning drain at Pune residential society
99.article_body: At least three workers died of asphyxiation while cleaning a drain at a residential society in Pune's Wagholi area on Friday morning, a fire brigade official said. The victims entered the drain around 6 am and local residents informed the police and the fire brigade when they noticed that they were not responding around 7 am.

100.title: Chahal's wife Dhanashree trolls Urvashi with 'My heart led me to Australia' post
100.article_body: While going to join husband Yuzvendra Chahal for the T20 World Cup, choreographer Dhanashree trolled actress Urvashi Rautela in an Instagram post. Sharing a picture from a plane, Dhanashree wrote, "My [heart] led me to Australia, literally. Got to be there for my man." Earlier, Urvashi shared a flight selfie and wrote, "Followed my [heart]...it led me to Australia."

101.title: BJP responsible for garbage mountains in Delhi: AAP leader Saurabh Bharadwaj
101.article_body: After Union Home Minister Amit Shah accused AAP of step-motherly treatment towards the three municipal corporations in Delhi, AAP leader Saurabh Bharadwaj claimed that the BJP is responsible for garbage mountains in the national capital. "The BJP-led MCD was tasked with managing waste but still Delhi is categorised as one of the most unsanitary cities in our country," said Bharadwaj.

102.title: $40 bn wiped off digital ad firms' m-cap after Snap's revenue warning
102.article_body: After Snapchat-parent Snap on Thursday warned that it would see no revenue growth in the holiday quarter, shares of digital ad companies, including Meta and Google-owner Alphabet dropped by 4% and 2%, respectively. Snap's stock fell by 25%, while Pinterest's declined nearly 8%. The sell-off erased over $40 billion in market value from these firms and other internet ad companies.

103.title: Harry Potter-themed coins released in UK to celebrate 25 years of the series
103.article_body: The Royal Mint, which makes all the coins in the United Kingdom, has released Harry Potter-themed 50p coins to celebrate 25th anniversary of the publication of 'Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone' by JK Rowling in 1997. Royal Mint designer Ffion Gwillim, who modelled the artwork onto coins, said, "The Harry Potter illustrations are so iconic and recognisable."

104.title: IIT graduates' GlobalFair raises $20 mn in Series A funding round
104.article_body: GlobalFair, a B2B building material supplier started by two IIT graduates, Shaily Garg and Ashish Chandra, has secured $20 million in Series A funding round through equity and debt. Lightspeed Venture Partners led the funding round, which also saw participation from Saama Capital, Stride Ventures, India Quotient, and AUM Ventures.

105.title: Doctor, wife die by electrocution from geyser at Hyderabad apartment
105.article_body: A 26-year-old doctor and his 22-year-old wife reportedly died by electrocution from the geyser at their apartment in Hyderabad. The woman's father found the bodies of the couple in the bathroom. The police suspect that the woman suffered electric shock from the geyser first and her husband got electrocuted while trying to save her.

106.title: U'khand HC asks SIT to file status report in Ankita Bhandari murder case
106.article_body: Uttarakhand High Court on Thursday directed the Special Investigation Team (SIT) investigating the Ankita Bhandari murder case to file a status report along with the case diary. HC fixed November 3 as the date for the next hearing. This comes after a plea was filed by a resident of Pauri Garhwal seeking that the probe is handed over to CBI.

107.title: Jaffer lists T20 World Cup teams' weaknesses, trolls England for not having a PM
107.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter to list T20 World Cup 2022 teams' weaknesses. He wrote, "India don't have a 150 kmph+ bowler. Pakistan don't have a seasoned finisher. New Zealand don't have great record in Australia. Sri Lanka don't have an experienced squad." Trolling England over the current political situation, he joked, "England don't have a Prime Minister."

108.title: I'm shaking, won't recover for another week: Kangana after watching 'Kantara'
108.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut said that she was "shaking" after watching 'Kantara'. "What an explosive experience. Rishab Shetty, hats off to you...I heard so many people in the theatre say that they had never seen anything like this. Thank you for this film. I don't think I will recover from this experience for another week," she added.

109.title: CRPF constable rapes woman on pretext of marriage in Delhi; held
109.article_body: A CRPF constable was arrested for allegedly raping a woman multiple times in Delhi, police said on Thursday. The woman had filed a complaint against the accused claiming that he raped her on the pretext of marriage, according to police. Both the accused and complainant are in process of getting separated from their respective spouses, an officer said.

110.title: Major Mumbai roads, traffic islands to be illuminated between Oct 22-29
110.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to illuminate major public places, roads, traffic islands and other places in Mumbai between October 22 and 29, reports said. "Funds for these works have been classified as incidental expenditure to each ward office. Therefore, immediate action should be taken by calling for spot tenders," a BMC release said.

111.title: US diplomat's wife pleads guilty over UK car crash that killed teen
111.article_body: Anne Sacoolas, the wife of an American diplomat, pleaded guilty on Thursday to causing the death of a teenager by driving carelessly in England in August 2019. The 19-year-old, Harry Dunn, was killed when his motorcycle was hit by Sacoolas' car near a US military base in Northamptonshire. Following the incident, Sacoolas fled the UK under diplomatic immunity.

112.title: Liz Truss entitled to ₹1 crore/year for life despite only serving 45 days as UK PM
112.article_body: Liz Truss is entitled to £115,000 (over ₹1 crore) per year for the rest of her life as a former Prime Minister, despite only being in office for 45 days. Truss, who became the shortest-serving leader in British history, resigned amid massive economic crisis. She had defeated Indian-origin Rishi Sunak in the UK PM race.

113.title: Student ends life over fear of not getting job placement in Pune
113.article_body: A 22-year-old student allegedly died by suicide on Thursday over the fear of not being able to get a job placement in Pune. The deceased, who was studying design at a college in the city, was under immense pressure for the past few days, police said. The police have not revealed whether a suicide note was recovered from the deceased.

114.title: Over 7,000 unrecognised madrasas found in UP survey so far
114.article_body: Over 7,000 unrecognised madrasas have been found in Uttar Pradesh so far in the ongoing survey by the government, said UP Madarsa Education Board Chairman Iftikhar Ahmed Javed. "The number of these [unrecognised] madrasas is expected to go up as information is still pouring in," he added. "After the survey, we are going to clean the system," he further said.

115.title: Instagram update lets users block all existing accounts of a person
115.article_body: Instagram has made an update that allows users to block all existing accounts of a person. Last year, the social media platform gave users the ability to block a person from contacting them through any new accounts that they may create. Additionally, the platform said its 'Hidden Words' feature will now also support more languages including Russian, Bengali and Tamil.

116.title: SC grants interim bail to accused in 2017 Gurugram school murder case
116.article_body: Supreme Court on Thursday granted interim bail to the accused in the 2017 Gurugram school murder case in which the then 16-year-old had murdered his seven-year-old junior, Pradyuman Thakur. The Juvenile Justice Board on Monday ruled that the accused student should be tried as an adult and not as a juvenile. The accused has been in detention for five years.

117.title: PM offers prayers at Kedarnath Temple, wears 'Chola Dora' made by women of Chamba
117.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday offered prayers at Kedarnath Temple ahead of laying the foundation stone of Kedarnath Ropeway Project. PM Modi wore a traditional outfit popularly known as 'Chola Dora', which was made by women of Chamba. It was gifted to PM Modi during his recent visit to Himachal Pradesh.

118.title: HCL Founder Shiv Nadar donated ₹3 crore per day over the last year: Hurun
118.article_body: Shiv Nadar, the billionaire Founder and Chairman Emeritus of HCL Technologies, donated ₹3 crore per day over the last year, according to EdelGive Hurun India Philanthropy List 2022. The 77-year-old industrialist reclaimed the title of being 'India's Most Generous', topping the philanthropy list with a yearly donation of ₹1,161 crore. The primary cause of his philanthropy is arts and culture.

119.title: Chidambaram suggests PM meet with 5 professionals over falling rupee
119.article_body: Congress MP P Chidambaram has claimed that the government seems "helpless against the relentless" rupee depreciation. He suggested that PM Narendra Modi should hold a closed-door meeting with five "eminent professionals", including former RBI Governors, C Rangarajan, Y V Reddy and Raghuram Rajan, over the matter. BJP leader Amit Malviya criticised the suggestion, calling it "unsolicited" advice.

120.title: India reports 2,119 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 25,037
120.article_body: India reported 2,119 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 2,141 new COVID-19 cases. The active cases in India now stand at 25,037. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,28,953 following 10 casualties in the last 24 hours.

121.title: Russia turning Ukraine power grid into new battleground: Zelenskyy
121.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Thursday told European Union that "Russia's leadership has given the order to turn the energy system itself into a battlefield". The Russian strikes are "aimed at creating as many electricity and heat problems as possible for Ukraine this fall and winter and for as many Ukrainians as possible to go to your countries", he added.

122.title: Permira appoints ex-Warburg exec Siddharth Narayan as India head
122.article_body: UK-based global private equity firm Permira has appointed Siddharth Narayan as its India head, based in Mumbai. Prior to joining Permira, Narayan worked at American PE firm Warburg Pincus. He had also been associated with Lightspeed Venture Partners and McKinsey & Company. He holds an MBA from The Wharton School and is an alumnus of Indian Institute of Technology, Madras.

123.title: Make this Diwali a happy and healthy Diwali: Oleev
123.article_body: Oleev shared that since cooking oil used in food matters as much as the ingredients, one must make a conscious choice in choosing it, especially during the festive season. Oleev Active is a multisource oil with the goodness of olive oil for Indian cooking, it stated, encouraging customers to choose health, good habits and a proactive lifestyle this Diwali.

124.title: Don't follow rumours, wait for facts: Twitter on report of Musk firing 75% staff
124.article_body: Twitter's top lawyer told employees not to follow "rumours or leaked documents but rather wait for facts", after a report claimed that Elon Musk plans to lay off 75% of the company's entire workforce. Twitter doesn't have any confirmation of Musk's plans following the close of the deal, the company's top lawyer said, warning employees of "public rumours and speculation".

125.title: Illegal online horse betting racket busted in Hyderabad; 2 arrested
125.article_body: An illegal horse betting racket being run through WhatsApp was busted in Hyderabad, said police. Two suspects, a 45-year-old bookie and a 23-year-old accountant, were arrested. According to police, the accused ran the operation through a WhatsApp group named Turf Line and used to collect money through online apps PhonePe and Google Pay.

126.title: Sensex, Nifty gain on last trading day of Samvat 2078
126.article_body: The benchmark indices opened in the green on the last trading day of Samvat 2078 with the Sensex gaining 300 points and the Nifty above 17,600 points. Axis Bank, M&M, Titan Company, SBI Life Insurance and HDFC Life were among the major gainers on Nifty. The stocks of Bajaj Finance, TCS, Tech Mahindra, Power Grid Corporation and Divi's Labs slipped.

127.title: You can't have Bumrah breaking down 10 days before the World Cup: Roger Binny
127.article_body: BCCI President Roger Binny said that the cricket board needs to address why and how players are breaking down "so easily". "You can't have Jasprit Bumrah breaking down 10 days before the World Cup," he added. "It's not...we don't have good trainers or coaches. Whether...load is too much, whether they're playing too many formats...something needs to be done," Binny said.

128.title: Bengaluru becomes 2nd Indian city to get 90-m aerial ladder platform
128.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Thursday dedicated a 90-metre aerial ladder platform vehicle to the Bengaluru Fire Department, which would allow officials to reach high-rise buildings in emergency situations. Bengaluru became the second Indian city, after Mumbai, to have it. "Till now, the Bengaluru Fire Department had only a 50-metre ladder," said Bommai.

129.title: 19-yr-old Grandmaster Hans Niemann sues Carlsen, others for $100 mn over cheating claims
129.article_body: US' 19-year-old Grandmaster Hans Niemann has sued world chess champion Magnus Carlsen, Chess.com and others for slander and libel over cheating allegations. Niemann stated the defendants are "colluding to blacklist" him from professional chess world. The lawsuit claims the defendants have made "defamatory statements" by accusing him of cheating and the claims have resulted in him being ostracised.

130.title: Maharashtra govt decides to waive farmers' loans of over ₹964 crore
130.article_body: The Maharashtra government has decided to write off loans of over ₹964 crore taken by farmers from land development banks (LDBs) in the state. Over 34,000 farmers, who had taken loans from these banks over two decades ago, are set to benefit from the decision. It has also approved the payment of another ₹275.40 crore to employees of LDBs.

131.title: University accused of hiring 'pretty' teacher for attendance in China, reacts after criticism
131.article_body: A university in China's Henan province was widely criticised after it was accused of hiring a teacher named Zhang because of her looks to boost attendance. Refuting the allegations, the university said it "trusted her excellent teaching ability and decided to hire her". The accusations surfaced after teaching videos of Zhang, who has over 4.3 lakh TikTok followers, went viral.

132.title: US reacts after Kashmiri journalist stopped from flying to US to collect Pulitzer
132.article_body: US has reacted after Kashmiri journalist Sanna Irshad Mattoo said she wasn't allowed to board a flight from Delhi to US to collect her Pulitzer Prize. "We...are tracking these developments closely. We are committed to supporting press freedom...A shared commitment to democratic values, including the respect for the independence of the press, is a bedrock of US-India relationship," US said.

133.title: PhonePe in talks to raise funds at $12 billion valuation: Report
133.article_body: PhonePe is in talks to raise funds from General Atlantic at over $12 billion valuation, Moneycontrol reported. General Atlantic is likely to lead the funding round with $450-$500 million investment. The investment would make the Walmart-backed startup the most-valued fintech in India. This will reportedly not be a pre-IPO round as PhonePe’s public listing is 2-3 years away.

134.title: Suzlon Energy's ₹1,200-crore rights issue subscribed 1.8 times
134.article_body: Suzlon Energy, on Thursday, said that its ₹1,200-crore rights issue has been subscribed by 1.8 times. The 240 crore partly paid-up equity shares for cash were issued from October 11 to October 20. The allotment and listing formalities of the new shares on the BSE and the NSE are expected to be completed by the first week of November.

135.title: Iranian troops in Crimea helping Russia in its war on Ukraine: US
135.article_body: Iran has deployed military experts in Crimea to help Russian forces conduct attacks on Ukraine's infrastructure and civilian population with Iran-made drones, the US alleged. The US will "pursue all means" to "expose, deter and confront Iran's provision of these munitions against...Ukrainians", US National Security Council spokesman John Kirby said. Russia annexed Crimea from Ukraine in 2014.

136.title: 192 private bus operators fined ₹14.96 lakh over ticket fares in Pune
136.article_body: Pune Regional Transport Office fined 192 private bus operators ₹14.96 lakh in a week for increasing ticket fares. "There are clear and strict guidelines...private tourist bus operators cannot increase fares more than 1.5 times compared to Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation fares," an official said. "Action was taken for overcharging passengers and overcrowding buses," the official added.

137.title: 5 policemen assault couple who refused to share hookah in Gurugram
137.article_body: Five policemen were suspended after they allegedly assaulted an elderly couple at their house in a village in Gurugram. The incident occurred after the couple apparently refused to share their hookah with the policemen, who were in plain clothes, as they appeared to be drunk. "Two of the accused were carrying weapons and threatening [the couple]," the couple's son claimed.

138.title: Delhi woman who accused 5 men of gangrape, inserting rod filed fake case: UP Police
138.article_body: Police in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad have said a Delhi woman's complaint alleging that five men gangraped her and inserted a rod in private parts was a "made up and fabricated case". Police stated that the case was planned to nail the five men over a land dispute. Her three friends have been arrested on the basis of their confessional statement.

139.title: B'luru Metro barricades on Outer Ring Road to be removed by Sep 2023
139.article_body: Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) has announced a schedule for the removal of barricades placed across the city owing to construction work. It said that the Metro barricades would be removed from the entire stretch of the Outer Ring Road by September 2023. Barricades on Doddenakundi-DRDO Sports Complex will be removed by February 2023, it added.

140.title: Chinese woman living as Nepali monk in Delhi arrested, police say 'she may be a spy'
140.article_body: A Chinese woman suspected of spying has been arrested from a Tibetan refugee settlement in Delhi. Her identity papers showed her name as Dolma Lama, with an address in Nepal's capital Kathmandu, the police said. The woman, whose real name is Cai Ruo, was living under the disguise of a Buddhist monk.

141.title: 4 persons hunt turtles to cook their meat in Pune; arrested
141.article_body: Four people who were allegedly hunting turtles to cook their meat have been arrested in Pune. The forest department made the arrests after they went to check the house of one of the accused and found pieces of turtles in a cooking utensil near it. The accused were arrested under different sections of the Wild Life (Protection) Act.

142.title: Delhi Police seizes 13,700 kg firecrackers in Oct, 75 cases registered
142.article_body: Delhi Police seized over 13,700 kilograms of firecrackers from October 1 to 19 and registered 75 cases for storage or sale. Police registered six cases in connection with bursting of firecrackers in October. Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai recently said that bursting firecrackers on Diwali will attract a jail term of six months and a fine of ₹200.

143.title: Ronaldo releases statement after getting dropped for Chelsea game over walkout controversy
143.article_body: Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo has released a statement after getting dropped for Chelsea match. Ronaldo, who stormed down the tunnel during match against Tottenham, said, "I've always tried to set...example...for...youngsters...[but] sometimes...heat of the moment gets the best of us." "This is Manchester United...and united we must stand. Soon we'll be together again," he added.

144.title: 25-yr-old man killed as vehicle hits bike in Gurugram, his friend critical
144.article_body: A 25-year-old labourer was killed while his friend was injured after the motorcycle that they were travelling on was hit by an unidentified vehicle in Gurugram, reports said. The deceased's friend is currently undergoing treatment and his condition is said to be critical. Reports said that no arrests have been made in the case as of now.

145.title: Elon Musk plans to lay off 75% of Twitter's workforce: Report
145.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk has told prospective investors that he intends to lay off nearly 75% of Twitter's 7,500-member workforce, Washington Post reported citing documents. The report said that Twitter's current management planned to cut almost a quarter of the workforce, paring $800 million from company's payroll. Musk is expected to close the purchase of Twitter by October 28.

146.title: Sehwag picks Pakistan captain Babar Azam to be 2022 T20 WC's top-scorer
146.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag has picked Pakistan captain Babar Azam to end up being the 2022 T20 World Cup's top-scorer. "Babar has been extraordinary...There is a sense of calmness whenever Virat Kohli bats and you get something similar when watching Babar," added Sehwag. Interestingly, ex-England captain Michael Vaughan also picked Babar to be the top-scorer in the tournament.

147.title: Robotic surgery far superior to conventional surgery: B'luru doctors
147.article_body: According to doctors in Bengaluru, robot-assisted surgery is revolutionising healthcare and is far superior to conventional surgery. "Robot-assisted surgery gives better results. Patients have less pain and they are able to get back to work early and get back to their normal lifestyle," said Dr Jagadish J Hiremath, Founder of the AASRA Group of Hospitals.

148.title: List shows areas in Bengaluru which will face power cuts today
148.article_body: Bangalore Electricity Supply Company (BESCOM) said parts of Bengaluru will face power cuts today as the Karnataka Power Transmission Corporation will be undertaking some maintenance works. The divisions which will remain affected are - Ramanagara, Whitefield, Additional East Shivajinagar division, and Tiptur. The power outages will occur for five hours between 10 am and 3 pm.

149.title: Fake policeman replaces tailor's gold worth ₹70,000 with milk packets in Mira Bhayandar
149.article_body: A man posing as a policeman robbed a 58-year-old tailor of his gold ornaments worth ₹70,000. The man told the tailor, who was walking back home, that a robbery had taken place and asked him to place the gold ornaments he wore in the man's handkerchief for safety. The tailor found empty milk packets in the handkerchief after reaching home.

150.title: Unable to get job, drunkard kidnaps sister near Mumbai; demands ransom
150.article_body: A 25-year-old man kidnapped his five-year-old cousin and demanded ransom from her family near Mumbai on Wednesday, as he was unable to get a job and wanted to fuel his alcoholism. The accused took the victim out, offering to get her sweets, but later demanded ₹1 lakh from her family to return her safe and sound, a police officer said.

151.title: Celebrate your Nayi Shuruat ki #PehliDiwali with Alekhya: Tanishq
151.article_body: Tanishq shared that it is celebrating every new beginning in its 'Nayi Shuruat ki #PehliDiwali' campaign urging everyone to rejoice in milestones with a reminder that when you celebrate your own 'nayi shuruat,' every Diwali feels like your #PehliDiwali. It unveiled the Alekhya collection inspired by the intricate art of Pichwai, available across all Tanishq stores.

152.title: Around 50 killed in anti-government protests: Chad Prime Minister
152.article_body: Around 50 people were killed and dozens were injured on Thursday in the anti-government protests in Chad, said Prime Minister Saleh Kebzabo. Violence started after protesters, who are demanding a swift transition to democratic rule, set ablaze the prime minister's party headquarters. "What happened today is an armed popular uprising...those responsible...will face justice," said Kebzabo.

153.title: Boris Johnson could be in race to replace UK PM Truss: Report
153.article_body: Former UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson may enter the race to replace Liz Truss as the Conservative Party's leader, The Times reported. "He's (Johnson) taking soundings but is said to believe it is a matter of national interest," The Times Political Editor Steven Swinford tweeted. Liz Truss resigned on Thursday as UK Prime Minister after just 45 days in office.

154.title: AAP releases 6th list of 20 candidates for Gujarat elections
154.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Thursday released its sixth list of 20 candidates for the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections. It has fielded Parvat Vagodia from Santrampur, Dinesh Munia from Dahod, Viral Panchal from Manjalpur, Mahendra Navadiya from Surat North, Sunit Gamit from Dang and Chetan Gajera from Junagadh. The party has declared 73 candidates for the elections so far.

155.title: Namibia record highest-ever 8th wicket partnership in T20 World Cup history
155.article_body: Namibia recorded the highest-ever partnership for the eighth wicket in T20 World Cup history. Ruben Trumpelmann and David Wiese shared a 70-run stand against UAE in a T20 World Cup 2022 first round match to set the record. The previous record was held by England's Moeen Ali and David Willey, who shared a 57*-run stand against Afghanistan in 2016 edition.

156.title: Ronaldo dropped from Man Utd squad for Chelsea match for storming down the tunnel
156.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo has been dropped from Manchester United squad for the Premier League match against Chelsea. This comes after Ronaldo stormed down the tunnel in 90th minute against Tottenham Hotspur on Wednesday. Ronaldo, who was named as substitute, was not brought on to play against Tottenham. "Rest of the squad is fully focused on preparing for [Chelsea match]," United said.

157.title: Uganda's Ebola outbreak 'rapidly evolving': WHO official
157.article_body: The Ebola outbreak in Uganda is "rapidly evolving", a top World Health Organization (WHO) official said on Thursday. "The Ministry of Health of Uganda has shown remarkable resilience and effectiveness and (is) constantly fine-tuning a response to what is a challenging situation," WHO Regional Director for Africa Dr Matshidiso Moeti said. Uganda on September 20 had declared an Ebola outbreak.

158.title: IIT Goa project will come to reality in Sanguem: State minister
158.article_body: State minister Subhash Phal Dessai on Thursday stated that the plan to build an IIT campus in Goa will come to reality in Sanguem. Farmers have been protesting in Goa, claiming land was being acquired for the project without their consent. "Instead of protesting, people should submit their property papers and settle, if they've encroached (into government areas)," Dessai said.

159.title: Pilots flying over Pacific Ocean spot several UFOs: Report
159.article_body: UFOs are being sighted in the sky over Pacific Ocean for last two months, according to a UFO researcher. Ben Hansen, former FBI agent and host of 'UFO Witness', procured footage and air traffic control recordings of mid-air UFO sightings by pilots, reported New York Post. In one account, a former military pilot reported seeing multiple aircraft flying above him.

160.title: The Bharat Army welcomes Team India in Melbourne ahead of Pakistan match, shares video
160.article_body: The Bharat Army, the official Team India supporters' group, welcomed Team India on their arrival in Melbourne ahead of their T20 World Cup 2022 match against Pakistan. The group shared a video wherein captain Rohit Sharma can be seen cutting a cake at the airport. The video also contained pictures of Team India players with members of The Bharat Army.

161.title: Schedule for Team India's December tour of Bangladesh announced
161.article_body: The Bangladesh Cricket Board on Thursday announced the schedule for India's tour of the country in December. India will arrive in Bangladesh on December 1. India will play three ODIs against Bangladesh on December 4, 7 and 10 in Dhaka. India will then play a Test match in Chattogram from December 14 and another Test in Dhaka from December 22.

162.title: BJP protests near Raj Bhavan in J'khand for OBC quota in ULB polls
162.article_body: The BJP OBC cell on Thursday staged a protest near Jharkhand's Raj Bhavan to demand reservation for Other Backward Classes in the upcoming Urban Local Body (ULB) elections in the state. Jharkhand Cabinet recently announced that ULB elections will be conducted next year without reservation for OBCs. The announcement came despite the state's nod to hike OBC reservation to 27%.

163.title: Towels soaked in liquid gold seized by customs officials at Cochin airport
163.article_body: A man was caught by customs officials at the Cochin International Airport for smuggling gold and six towels soaked in liquid gold were seized from him. The amount of gold has not yet been determined. The man had boarded the SG-54 SpiceJet flight to arrive at the Cochin International Airport.

164.title: Centre aims to raise defence sector turnover to $22 bn: Rajnath
164.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said the Centre aims to raise the turnover of India's defence production to $22 billion by 2025, which is presently $12 billion. Speaking at the Defence Expo 2022 in Gandhinagar on Thursday, Singh appealed to private players in the defence sector to invest in India. "The Indian defence industry is the sunrise sector," he said.

165.title: 6.7 magnitude earthquake hits western Panama
165.article_body: A 6.7 magnitude earthquake hit western Panama on Thursday morning. There was no initial report of damage. The tremor was felt in Herrera, Bocas Del Toro, Veraguas and western Panama, the National Civil Defense agency said. According to the US Geological Survey, the earthquake occurred 62 km south-southwest of Boca Chica off the Pacific coast.

166.title: Navjot Sidhu taken to hospital after he falls sick in Patiala jail
166.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu, who is lodged in Patiala Central Jail in a 1988 road rage case, was taken to a hospital for check-up after he fell sick. State Jails Minister Harjot Singh Bains said that he personally enquired about Sidhu's health. Meanwhile, CM Bhagwant Mann said Sidhu will get ample security for a hearing in a Ludhiana case.

167.title: Congress remembers Dalits only during its tough times: Mayawati
167.article_body: Bahujan Samaj Party President Mayawati on Thursday said the Congress party remembers Dalits only during its tough times. The statement was made a day after Dalit leader Mallikarjun Kharge was elected as the Congress' President. "The history of Congress is a witness that they have always neglected/disdained the messiah of the downtrodden Dr Bhimrao Ambedkar and his society," Mayawati tweeted.

168.title: Kerala Congress MLA gets bail in case of rape, attempt to murder
168.article_body: A Kerala court on Thursday granted anticipatory bail to Congress MLA Eldhose Kunnappilly in a case of rape and attempt to murder. It asked Kunnappilly to surrender his passport and barred him from leaving Kerala without police's permission. He's accused of raping a 35-year-old woman on the promise of marriage and later offering her ₹30 lakh to settle the case.

169.title: EU countries agree on sanctioning Iranian officials over drones used against Ukraine
169.article_body: The European Union has agreed on sanctions to target officials in Tehran over Russia striking Ukraine with Iranian-made drones. EU official Nabila Massrali said there is evidence that suggests the drones used by Russia were from Iran. "EU states decided to freeze the assets of three individuals and one entity responsible for drone deliveries," said the Czech EU presidency.

170.title: Verventa Holdings gets CCI approval to acquire up to 10% in Yes Bank
170.article_body: Verventa Holdings, an affiliate of Advent International, has received approval from the Competition Commission of India (CCI) to acquire equity securities of up to 10% in Yes Bank. Verventa Holdings Ltd (Acquirer) is an investment holding company. In July, Yes Bank's board had approved raising ₹8,898 crore in equity capital from Carlyle and Advent International.

171.title: Meta oversight board can apply warning screen on 'sensitive' content
171.article_body: Meta's independent oversight board can soon apply warning screen on content marking it "sensitive" or "disturbing". The board can also apply a warning screen when it is leaving up content or restoring content including photos and videos. A report from the board stated that they have received close to two million appeals from users globally in the last two years.

172.title: BJP shouldn't give excuses for failing to run MCD: Kejriwal
172.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday said the BJP should not make "excuses" for its 15-year-long "failure" in running the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD). Earlier, Union Home Minister Amit Shah had said Kejriwal wanted Delhi to be 'AAP Nirbhar', while the BJP aims to make it 'Atmanirbhar'. "Why should people trust you (BJP)...we will make Delhi garbage-free," Kejriwal tweeted.

173.title: All FTA talks, including with the UK, on track: Piyush Goyal
173.article_body: Minister of Commerce and Industry Piyush Goyal said that talks on free trade agreements (FTA) with Britain, Canada and the EU are still on track. Goyal's statement came hours after British Prime Minister Liz Truss announced her resignation just six weeks into the job.
