347.article_body: A 25-year-old UK prison nurse has been jailed after exchanging "flirtatious" texts and calls with a male inmate. Elyse Hibbs met the inmate when she gave him medical treatment. The prisoner then used his mother and a friend to track down Hibbs on Instagram. Hibbs gave them her mobile number, following which she and the inmate started exchanging phone calls.

348.title: Sri Lanka defeat Netherlands, qualify for Super 12 stage of T20 World Cup 2022
348.article_body: Sri Lanka defeated Netherlands by 16 runs in their last T20 World Cup 2022 first round match in Geelong. With this, Sri Lanka have qualified for the Super 12 stage of the tournament. Sri Lanka are on top of the Group A table with four points. Netherlands will qualify for the next stage if UAE defeat Namibia today.

349.title: We condemn VIP culture: Doctors on AIIMS SOPs for treatment of MPs
349.article_body: Doctors' bodies opposed new standard operating procedures of AIIMS for the treatment of parliamentarians. "We condemn VIP culture. No patient should suffer at the cost of another's privileges," said Federation of Resident Doctors' Association. "Every patient in this country deserves good treatment. That includes an MP and also a homeless person," said Federation of All India Medical Association.

350.title: Lupin to buy 2 inhalation brands from Sunovion for $75 million
350.article_body: Lupin will acquire two inhalation medicines, Brovana Inhalation Solution and Xopenex Inhalation Aerosol, from Sunovion Pharmaceuticals Inc. The transaction will take place for a cash consideration of $75 million. Brovana is used in the treatment of chronic bronchitis and Xopenex is used in the prevention of bronchospasm in adults, adolescents and children aged four and above.

351.title: Gandhi family's supremacy to continue: Ashwani Kumar on Cong chief poll results
351.article_body: After Congress Presidential poll results were declared on Wednesday, ex-Union Minister Ashwani Kumar said the supremacy of the Gandhi family will continue despite Mallikarjun Kharge becoming the party chief. "As long as the Gandhi family is there, they will be dominant," Kumar added. He stated that Kharge would not be able to succeed in the party without Sonia Gandhi’s support.

352.title: Over ₹27 lakh fine imposed on construction sites in Noida for violating norms
352.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh Pollution Control Board along with Noida authority started joint inspections to ensure that all dust control measures are being followed, especially at construction sites. Around ₹9.5 lakh fine was imposed on Monday at different sites while another ₹17.6 lakh fine was imposed on Tuesday. Penalty of ₹5 lakh was imposed on private contractor who constructed Signature Bridge.

353.title: Pak will have difficulties facing Shami, Bhuvi in Aus conditions: Aaqib Javed
353.article_body: Former Pakistan pacer Aaqib Javed has said that the absence of Jasprit Bumrah from India's squad won't make much of a difference in Australian conditions. "Bumrah ends up making a difference even on flat pitches...Mohammad Shami, Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Mohammed Siraj are good seam bowlers. So, Pakistan will have difficulties," explained Aaqib. "Runs won't come easy (for Pakistan)," he added.

354.title: Bengaluru witnessed at least one child marriage every month since 2020: Data
354.article_body: More than one child marriage is illegally solemnised every month in Bengaluru urban and rural combined, data from the Department of Women and Child Development showed. A total of 47 marriages occurred in Bengaluru between 2020 and August 2022, according to the data. In 2022 alone, till August, 51 complaints of child marriages were reported in the city.

355.title: Builder Paras Porwal jumps to death from 23rd floor in Mumbai
355.article_body: Well-known Mumbai builder Paras Porwal jumped to death from the 23rd floor of the Shantikamal Cooperative Housing Society building near Chinchpokli station on Thursday morning. According to the police, the 57-year-old jumped from the balcony of his gym. A police official told The Indian Express that Porwal allegedly died by suicide because of personal issues.

356.title: Ukrainians told to 'charge everything' after Russia attacks power plants
356.article_body: Ukraine's national energy company, Ukrenergo, urged citizens to "charge everything" by Thursday morning amid expected electricity cuts as power plants were hit by Russian missiles. "From October 10, Ukrainian energy system has suffered an attack from the enemy greater than in 8 months of war," it added. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said 30% of power stations were destroyed in strikes.

357.title: Russia to evacuate 10,000 people a day from occupied Kherson region
357.article_body: Russian-installed authorities in the occupied Ukrainian region of Kherson have planned to evacuate 10,000 people a day over the next six days as Ukraine prepares for counter-offensive in the area. Kherson residents received warnings via texts on the urgent need to evacuate, Russian media reported. Russian forces in Kherson have been driven back 20-30 km in the last few weeks.

358.title: Tracxn Technologies' shares surge nearly 6% on market debut
358.article_body: Tracxn Technologies' stock, which made its secondary market debut on Thursday, opened on BSE at ₹84.5 apiece, which is a premium of ₹4.5 or 5.6% over the upper end of its IPO price range. On NSE, its shares opened at ₹83 apiece, a premium of ₹Rs 3 or 3.8%. At 11:30 am, its stock was trading 18.44% higher on NSE.

359.title: Police arrest 4 in possession of MD in separate cases, 2 FIRs lodged
359.article_body: Pune City Police arrested four persons in possession of the banned drug mephedrone (MD) in two separate cases and lodged two FIRs. In the first case, police recovered 6.970 grams of MD worth over ₹1.09 lakh from the possession of an accused. In the second case, police recovered 7.690 grams of MD worth over ₹1.15 lakh.

360.title: BJP leaders attend rape convict Ram Rahim's online satsang in Karnal
360.article_body: BJP leaders, including Karnal Mayor Renu Bala Gupta, attended an online satsang conducted by Dera Sacha Sauda chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim, a rape and murder convict who is out on parole. In a video, Gupta can be seen seeking blessings from Rahim and calling him 'pitaji' (father). Gupta said her participation should not be seen as a political move.

361.title: Extremely challenging: Kajal Aggarwal on balancing work & motherhood
361.article_body: Actress Kajal Aggarwal on Wednesday penned a note speaking about how balancing work and motherhood has been "extremely challenging". The actress shared that being a mother has been the most "rewarding job". She added, "I've gone from a scared young woman holding a wriggling mass on her chest...to now fulfilling mommy duties and learning as I go along."

362.title: Don't date an actor: Janhvi's dating advice to sister Khushi Kapoor
362.article_body: Speaking about the dating advice she'd give to her sister Khushi Kapoor, actress Janhvi Kapoor said she'd tell her to not date an actor. Citing the reason behind it, Janhvi said, "Just because I think the kind of girls I and her are, I just think it would be better." Janhvi added that she'd want Khushi to know her worth.

363.title: Kohli can teach you how to go through pressure situations: Pant
363.article_body: India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant has said it's good to have a batting partner like Virat Kohli in high-pressure matches like the upcoming game against Pakistan in the 2022 T20 World Cup. "Kohli can actually teach you how to go through situations...and how to maintain that run-a-ball pressure," said Pant. The India-Pakistan match will be played on October 23.

364.title: Video showing Indian Americans blocking US road for wedding procession goes viral
364.article_body: A video showing several Indian Americans dancing to Indian songs as part of a wedding procession in New York has gone viral. "We shut down broadway for my brother's wedding!" read the text insert in the video shared by Suraj Patel. Reacting to the video, a social media user wrote, "Isn't this a grave inconvenience to residents?"

365.title: Have a guess, says King Charles after school kid asks his age; video surfaces
365.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media wherein King Charles III can be seen interacting with children from the Barn Croft Primary School in East London. In the video, a child asked the King, "How old are you, King Charles?" To which he responded, "Have a guess", following which the students and teachers could be heard laughing.

366.title: Intellemo raises ₹3 cr in Inflection Point Ventures-led seed round
366.article_body: Digital marketing startup Intellemo has secured over ₹3 crore in a seed funding round led by Inflection Point Ventures. The funding round also saw participation from Cred Founder Kunal Shah, Fitso Co-founders Rahool Sureka and Saurabh Aggarwal, and Badri Ecofibres Co-founder Amit Gupta. The company was co-founded in 2018 by Saurabh Gupta, Tusha Agrawal and Shivam Gupta.

367.title: India reports 2,141 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 25,510
367.article_body: India reported 2,141 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 1,946 new COVID-19 cases. The active cases in India now stand at 25,510. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,28,943 following 20 casualties in the last 24 hours.

368.title: Over 10 stray dogs caught from Noida Sector 100 after infant's death
368.article_body: Dogcatchers caught over 10 stray dogs from Noida Sector 100 after receiving complaints from residents about the presence of more "aggressive" community dogs in the area. The Noida authority had dispatched dogcatchers to relocate and rehabilitate the canines. The step comes after an infant was mauled to death by a stray dog in Noida's Lotus Boulevard society.

369.title: Airtel 5G Plus is now live in 8 cities: Airtel
369.article_body: Airtel has launched Airtel 5G Plus in 8 cities like Delhi, Mumbai, Chennai and more in a phased manner. The network offers 30X higher speed and works on 5G-enabled devices and handsets with existing Airtel SIMs, it revealed. Airtel 5G Plus also runs on the most widely accepted technology in the world with the most developed ecosystem.

370.title: Didn’t pitch myself as candidate of dissent but change: Cong’s Tharoor
370.article_body: After Shashi Tharoor on Wednesday conceded defeat in Congress Presidential election, he said, "I didn't pitch myself as a candidate of dissent but change...change in the manner in which we will do our regular work." Furthermore, he added, "I would stress it is not so much about dissent but how to make a good party better."

371.title: Tesla posts $21.45 billion revenue in Q3, net income at $3.3 billion
371.article_body: Tesla's revenue for the third quarter was $21.45 billion, short of analysts' estimates of $21.96 billion. Its net income was $3.3 billion, nearly doubled the $1.62 billion it earned in the same period last year. The company said it had a negative foreign exchange impact of $250 million on its earnings as the US dollar strengthened against major currencies.

372.title: Cyberabad She Teams received 1,571 harassment cases until Sept this year
372.article_body: The Cyberabad She Teams received as many as 1,571 harassment cases, the highest in the state, according to the data released by the Women Safety Wing of Telangana Police on Wednesday. The data states the number of cases till September end this year. Additional Director General of Police, Swati Lakra, said that 331 She Teams are working across Telangana currently.

373.title: Droom Technology, Aprameya Engineering withdraw IPO plans
373.article_body: Automobile e-commerce platform Droom Technology and medical equipment maker Aprameya Engineering have withdrawn their initial public offering (IPO) plans, according to a notification on the SEBI's website. In November 2021, Droom had sought SEBI's approval for an IPO. Aprameya Engineering had filed for an IPO in September 2022 planning to issue 50 lakh shares via fresh issue.

374.title: Canada to host meeting of female foreign ministers to discuss Iran protests
374.article_body: Canada to host a virtual meeting of female foreign ministers on Thursday to discuss Iran's "brutal" crackdown on protests ignited by 22-year-old Mahsa Amini's death after being detained by the morality police. "My counterparts and I'll gather to send a clear message: the Iranian regime must end all forms of violence and persecution against...Iranians," Canadian Foreign Minister Melanie Joly said.

375.title: I wanted people to remember: Shaheen on 2021 WC game vs India
375.article_body: Talking about the 2021 T20 WC match against India in which he dismissed Rohit Sharma, KL Rahul and Virat Kohli, Pakistan's Shaheen Afridi said he wanted people to remember his performance for ages. "I had observed Rohit struggle against inswingers...I thought why not use it," he recalled. "Shoaib Malik asked me...to go for a length ball [against Rahul]," revealed Shaheen.

376.title: 3 children buried to death under earthen boulders in UP's Etah
376.article_body: At least three children died after they got buried under huge earthen boulders in the Nayagaon Police Station area in Uttar Pradesh's Etah on Wednesday, police said. The deceased, all 12 years old, were reportedly on their way home from school when the incident happened. Searches were conducted by the locals after the children didn't return home from school.

377.title: No hotel, no staff: Ricky Kej on being stranded in Istanbul due to flight diversion
377.article_body: Grammy-winning Indian-origin composer Ricky Kej took to Twitter after his Lufthansa Frankfurt-Bengaluru flight was diverted to Istanbul due to a medical emergency on October 18. Sharing a series of tweets, Kej wrote, "Over 31 hours now...Thanks to the utter disregard of Indian passengers by Lufthansa. Still no...statement, or any information from them...Two nights now without a bed".

378.title: Ronaldo storms down tunnel after not being brought on to play against Spurs, pics surface
378.article_body: Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo was seen storming down the Old Trafford tunnel in the 90th minute after not being brought on by manager Erik ten Hag to play against Tottenham Hotspur (Spurs) in Premier League on Wednesday night. "I will deal with that tomorrow not today," Erik ten Hag said on Wednesday about the situation. United defeated Spurs 2-0.

379.title: China blocks proposal to designate son of Hafiz Saeed as UN-listed terrorist
379.article_body: A day after blocking the proposal to designate Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorist Shahid Mahmood as a global terrorist, China blocked a proposal by India and US at the UN to blacklist Hafiz Talah Saeed, son of Lashkar-e-Taiba chief Hafiz Saeed. This is the fifth time in four months that China has blocked proposals to designate Pakistan-based terrorists at the UN.

380.title: There was a time when I was arrogant: Varun on 10 years in B'wood
380.article_body: Varun Dhawan, who completed 10 years in Bollywood on Wednesday, opened up about the time when he was arrogant and didn't care about what people were saying. "There was a time when I'd think arrogantly, that everything is going fine, so why should I even care what someone is saying," he said at the trailer launch of his film 'Bhediya'.

381.title: GIC Affiliates to invest ₹1,045 cr in IRB Infra's Ganga e-way project
381.article_body: IRB Infrastructure Developers on Wednesday said Singapore-based GIC Affiliates will invest ₹1,045 crore in the Ganga Expressway project. IRB Infra has completed the equity raise of ₹533.20 crore for the project. GIC contributed ₹261.29 crore and IRB Infra, which will hold a 51% stake, contributed ₹271.90 crore. Both companies will invest a total of ₹2,133 crore in the project.

382.title: MPSC aspirants hold protest over non-payment of stipends in Pune
382.article_body: Students preparing for Maharashtra Public Service Commission (MPSC) held a protest against the state government at Pune's Shastri Road over non-payment of stipends they were promised under 'MahaJyoti' scheme. "We were selected to get the emergency funds and monthly stipends from the state government, but we have not yet received any amount,'' said an MPSC aspirant.

383.title: 5 Russians charged with procuring US military tech ahead of Ukraine war
383.article_body: US federal prosecutors have charged five Russians and two Venezuelans for their alleged roles in procuring American military technology ahead of Ukraine war. Some defendants have been accused of using a German firm to transport semiconductors and satellites that could be used in missile systems and fighter aircraft. Some equipment recovered on battlefields in Ukraine, US Justice Department said.

384.title: Tahir Hussain discharged of arson charge in a Delhi riots case
384.article_body: A Delhi Court discharged former AAP councillor Tahir Hussain and nine others in a case of arson in connection with the 2020 Delhi riots. "It's well apparent...IPC Section 436 (arson) was added without due application of mind," the court said. It remanded the matter back to the chief metropolitan magistrate for trial in other sections against the accused.

385.title: My best director: Salman as he shares Sooraj Barjatya's 'Uunchai' trailer
385.article_body: Bollywood actor Salman Khan called Sooraj Barjatya his "best director" and "one of the best human beings" he has met and worked with. On Wednesday, Salman shared the trailer of 'Uunchai' on Twitter and wished the director "all the best" for his upcoming directorial, which stars Amitabh Bachchan, Anupam Kher and others. The film will release on November 11.

386.title: We're not thinking about semis or final, will focus on each match: Rohit
386.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma has said it's too early to think about the knockout stage of the 2022 T20 World Cup. "We need to do a lot of things right to get there...[We'll] focus on each team we're going to come against," said Rohit in a video posted by BCCI. "Been a while since we won World Cup," he added.

387.title: Mumbai Police warns against sale of firecrackers without licence
387.article_body: The Mumbai Police issued a notice regarding the sale of firecrackers ahead of Diwali and said that those selling firecrackers without a licence will face consequences. "No person at any public place in the limits of Brihanmumbai shall sell, possess, offer, display, carry or expose for purpose of sale of any firecrackers or fireworks without a licence," the notice read.

388.title: Wall collapses near Bengaluru's Majestic bus station after heavy rain
388.article_body: As heavy rain lashed parts of Bengaluru on Wednesday, a wall collapsed near Majestic bus station damaging several cars parked near the wall. Several areas like Bellandur, Shivajinagara and parts of the IT corridor saw waterlogging after the heavy rainfall. Bengaluru has recorded the highest annual record of rainfall this year, with 1,700 mm of rainfall till October 18.

389.title: Conversion and migration causing population imbalance: RSS’ Hosabale
389.article_body: RSS General Secretary Dattatreya Hosabale on Wednesday said that religious conversion and migration from Bangladesh are causing "population imbalance" and called for strict implementation of anti-conversion laws. He stated that RSS is trying to create awareness on conversions. He said as a result, there has been a favourable outcome of “ghar wapsi”.

390.title: 2 Mumbai men arrested for running drug operation on social media
390.article_body: Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB), Mumbai has arrested two persons, both residents of Ghatkopar, for allegedly running a drug trafficking operation using social media platforms. According to NCB, the accused created a group named 'Party Pack' on Instagram for their operation. The suppliers and consumers of the syndicate are said to be spread across Maharashtra, Goa, Delhi, Gujarat and Andhra Pradesh.

391.title: Man charged for threatening to kill US President Biden, Capitol riots investigator
391.article_body: A US grand jury has indicted jailed 25-year-old Robert Vargo for threatening to kill US President Joe Biden, the chair of congressional committee investigating the US Capitol riots, Bennie Thompson and his family, prosecutors said. "You and Joe Biden soon will face death for the wrongs you've done to US," Vargo said in a letter he sent to Thompson's office.

392.title: Xi would be a sinner of all Chinese people if he attacks island: Taiwan
392.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping would become a "sinner" of all Chinese people if he attacked Taiwan, Chen Ming-tong, head of Taiwan's National Security Bureau, said. He also said that the Chinese President would face international sanctions and diplomatic isolation if he followed through on his threats of ever attacking Taiwan. China claims democratically governed Taiwan as its own territory.

393.title: Dogecoin creator asks if Musk is naming new COVID-19 variants, Tesla CEO replies
393.article_body:
Dogecoin creator Shibetoshi Nakamoto shared a screenshot of a news article mentioning the names of different COVID-19 variants. Sharing the screengrab, he wrote, "Did Elon Musk name these new covid variants." To which Musk replied saying, "Definitely giving me kid naming ideas."
In May 2020, Musk announced that he and singer Grimes have named their baby boy X Æ A-12.

394.title: Putin sent me 20 vodka bottles, I responded with 20 wine bottles: Ex-Italy PM Berlusconi
394.article_body: In a recording released by the LaPresse news agency, former Italy PM Silvio Berlusconi was heard saying, "I have reconnected with President Putin — a little, a lot." "He sent me 20 bottles of vodka and a really sweet letter for my birthday. I responded with 20 bottles of wine and a similarly sweet letter," Berlusconi said.

395.title: Builder, contractor booked after labourer falls to death in Pune
395.article_body: A builder and a contractor have been booked after a 30-year-old labourer fell from the third floor of a building undergoing construction and died in Pune's Kondhwa. The two have been accused of not following labour safety norms like providing helmets, safety nets and safety belts to labourers. "No arrest has been made in the case," said police.

396.title: Harbhajan Singh names his India playing XI for T20 World Cup match against Pakistan
396.article_body: Ex-India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh named his India playing XI for the T20 World Cup 2022 match against Pakistan, which is scheduled to take place on October 23. He named Rohit Sharma, KL Rahul, Virat Kohli and Suryakumar Yadav as the first four batters, followed by Hardik Pandya, Dinesh Karthik, Axar Patel, Yuzvendra Chahal, Arshdeep Singh, Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Mohammad Shami.

397.title: Impose ₹1,000 fine for not wearing seat belts: Centre to K'taka Police
397.article_body: Union Ministry of Road Transport and Highways has directed the Karnataka Police to increase the penalty for not wearing seat belts on four-wheelers, even to passengers in rear seats, from ₹500 to ₹1,000. Karnataka has recorded 31 deaths every day due to road accidents in 2022, till August end. Earlier, Mumbai Police made wearing seat belts compulsory from November 1.

398.title: Doctors told I had 2% chance to live: Matthew Perry on drug abuse in 2018
398.article_body: 'Friends' actor Matthew Perry said that in 2018, after his colon burst due to the overuse of opioids, doctors said he had a 2% chance to live. He said he spent two weeks in coma and had to use a colostomy bag for nine months. "I was put on a thing called an ECMO machine...No one survives that," he added.

399.title: Man Utd defeat Spurs, Liverpool beat West Ham; Chelsea held by Brentford
399.article_body: Manchester United and Liverpool registered wins in their respective matches in the Premier League on Wednesday night. United produced a dominant 2-0 win over Tottenham Hotspur, while Liverpool earned a narrow 1-0 victory over West Ham United. Chelsea were held to a 0-0 draw by Brentford, but they remain fourth on the points table with 20 points from 10 games.

400.title: Hyderabad's Qutb Shahi mosque land restored, ₹5 lakh given for damage
400.article_body: A survey of Hyderabad's Qutb Shahi mosque land was held on Wednesday and after verification, it was ascertained that the disputed land belongs to mosque. This comes after a group belonging to a particular community claimed that government had allocated some land there for a temple. A decision to sanction ₹5 lakh to repair the damaged wall was also taken.
